intro: Hemsleya chinensis var. longevillosa, commonly known as the long-hairy Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its specific variety name. It thrives in woodland and rocky habitats, often in partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
